abstract: Ray Kurzweil says his Blio e-reader software will give people electronic books with richer formatting similar to what they’re used to in print.
snippet: Ray Kurzweil says his Blio e-reader software will give people electronic books with richer formatting similar to what they’re used to in print.
lead_paragraph: There’s Amazon.com’s Kindle, Sony’s Reader, Barnes and Noble’s Nook, Apple’s iPad and a bevy of iPad and Kindle clones. Still, Ray Kurzweil, the famed inventor, thinks people deserve yet another option when it comes to reading books and magazines with an electronic device.

headline.main: Ray Kurzweil Vows to Right E-Reader Wrongs
